meanings.definition: A punishment or fate that someone deserves.
meanings.sent1: After being mean to his classmates, Timmy finally got his comeuppance.
meanings.sent2: The villain in the story met his comeuppance in the end.
meanings.sent3: The bully learned his lesson when he received his comeuppance.
meanings.sent4: Karma delivered a swift comeuppance to the dishonest man.
meanings.sent5: The comeuppance served as a reminder to always treat others kindly.

meanings.definition: A consequence or retribution for one's actions.
meanings.sent1: She knew that lying would eventually lead to her comeuppance.
meanings.sent2: The thief faced his comeuppance when he was caught by the police.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat received its comeuppance when it got stuck in a tree.
meanings.sent4: The comeuppance for skipping class was having to stay after school.
meanings.sent5: The comeuppance for cheating on the test was failing miserably.
